meanings.definition: A title of respect for a man
meanings.sent1: The misters greeted the guests warmly.
meanings.sent2: The misters in the room stood up when the lady entered.
meanings.sent3: The misters at the meeting shared stories and laughed.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the mister of the town, always helping others.
meanings.sent5: The kind mister always had a smile for everyone he met.

meanings.sent1: The gardeners used misters to water the plants gently.
meanings.sent2: The misters in the greenhouse kept the air moist for the plants.
meanings.sent3: The mister sprayed water playfully on the children in the park.
meanings.sent4: The mister in the fountain danced with water in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The mister on the patio created a refreshing spray on hot days.

meanings.definition: A man who mists plants or crops
meanings.sent1: The misters carefully sprayed the delicate flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The mister in the field ensured the crops were well-watered.
meanings.sent3: The mister jokingly called himself the 'plant whisperer'.
meanings.sent4: The mister's hands moved like magic, misting life into the plants.
meanings.sent5: The mister's expertise with misters made the garden bloom beautifully.
